meanings.definition: A person or thing that tenons.
meanings.sent1: The skilled carpenter used tenoners to join the pieces of wood together.
meanings.sent2: The factory had efficient tenoners that helped speed up the production process.
meanings.sent3: The little robot claimed to be one of the best tenoners in the business!
meanings.sent4: Her precision in woodworking made her the tenoners of the group, always ensuring perfect joints.
meanings.sent5: The tenoners in the workshop were like puzzle pieces, fitting perfectly to create beautiful furniture.

meanings.sent1: The new tenoners in the workshop made the cutting process much easier.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter invested in a high-quality tenoners to improve the accuracy of his cuts.
meanings.sent3: The tenoners in the factory had a dance-off to see who could cut the straightest tenon!
meanings.sent4: The old tenoners in the shed whispered stories of the intricate joints they had crafted.
meanings.sent5: The loud hum of the tenoners filled the workshop, signaling the start of another day of woodworking.
